reasoning: Reporting incidence of adult cases. Adult medulloblastoma represents only ~10-15% of all medulloblastomas, with incidence <0.05 per 100k adults. Extremely rare with limited epidemiological data.
source: Brandes AA et al. (2003). Adult neuroectodermal tumors of posterior fossa (medulloblastoma) and of supratentorial sites (stPNET). Crit Rev Oncol Hematol. 66:223-246
